sense_of_place.one_liner: Where the chants of monks meet the winter snow.

description.title: Welcome to Tawang
description.content: A high-altitude cultural sanctuary and the spiritual heart of the Monpa tribe.

land_and_memory.title: The Hidden Land
land_and_memory.content: Historically known as the 'Land of Mon', it shares deep cultural ties with Lhasa and memories of the 1962 border conflict.

sense_of_place.one_liner: The misty gateway to the high Himalayas.

description.title: Welcome to West Kameng
description.content: A transition zone between the humid foothills and snowy peaks, home to the Sherdukpen tribe.

land_and_memory.title: Trade Routes
land_and_memory.content: Historically, the Sherdukpen people maintained migratory trade relations with the plains of Assam.

sense_of_place.one_liner: The political and educational nucleus of the state.

description.title: Welcome to Papum Pare
description.content: Hosting the twin capital cities of Itanagar and Naharlagun, this is the melting pot of Arunachal.

land_and_memory.title: The Nyishi Homeland
land_and_memory.content: Once a dense jungle, now the center of governance, yet still rooted in Nyishi traditions.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Golden paddy fields surrounded by pine clad hills.

description.title: Welcome to Ziro
description.content: Home to the Apatani tribe, famous for their sustainable wet-rice cultivation and facial tattoos.

land_and_memory.title: Sustainable Harmony
land_and_memory.content: The Apatani practice of paddy-cum-fish cultivation is a UNESCO-recognized example of coexistence with nature.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Where tea gardens meet the river island.

description.title: Welcome to Jorhat
description.content: The heart of Assam's tea industry and home to Majuli, the world's largest river island.

land_and_memory.title: Satria Culture
land_and_memory.content: Majuli Island preserves the ancient Neo-Vaishnavite culture and mask-making traditions.

sense_of_place.one_liner: The bustling urban heart of the region.

description.title: Welcome to Guwahati
description.content: The most urbanized district, hosting the capital Dispur and the ancient Kamakhya Temple.

land_and_memory.title: Pragjyotishpura
land_and_memory.content: Known anciently as the 'City of Eastern Light', it has been a center of astrology and power for millennia.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Where the looms never stop clicking.

description.title: Welcome to Rural Kamrup
description.content: Home to Sualkuchi, the 'Manchester of the East', famous for its golden Muga silk.

land_and_memory.title: Weaving Legacy
land_and_memory.content: Generations of weavers in Sualkuchi have preserved the art of Muga and Pat silk weaving.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Where the lake reflects the sky.

description.title: Welcome to Bishnupur
description.content: Ecologically defined by Loktak Lake, the largest freshwater lake in the Northeast.

land_and_memory.title: Echoes of Moirang
land_and_memory.content: The ancient kingdom of Moirang, rich in folklore like the Khamba Thoibi epic.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Mist-covered hills and black pottery.

description.title: Welcome to Ukhrul
description.content: The home of the Tangkhul Nagas, famous for the rare Shirui Lily and Nungbi pottery.

land_and_memory.title: Black Pottery
land_and_memory.content: Longpi (Nungbi) pottery is crafted from crushed rock and black clay without a potter's wheel.

sense_of_place.one_liner: The misty hills where clouds come home.

description.title: Welcome to Shillong
description.content: The administrative titan of the state, home to the wettest places on earth: Sohra and Mawsynram.

land_and_memory.title: Sacred Groves
land_and_memory.content: Ancestors whisper in the rustling leaves of the Mawphlang Sacred Grove.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Where peace silk is spun from nature.

description.title: Welcome to Ri Bhoi
description.content: The industrial belt and the heart of the Eri Silk (Ryndia) cottage industry.

land_and_memory.title: Ahimsa Silk
land_and_memory.content: Ryndia (Eri Silk) is processed without killing the silkworm, reflecting a deep respect for life.

sense_of_place.one_liner: A city perched on a ridge, reaching for the sky.

description.title: Welcome to Aizawl
description.content: The primate city of Mizoram, housing nearly 40% of the state's population with high literacy.

land_and_memory.title: Tlawmngaihna
land_and_memory.content: The city beats to the rhythm of Tlawmngaihna, the Mizo code of selfless service.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Endless forests of green gold.

description.title: Welcome to Mamit
description.content: Famous for the Dampa Tiger Reserve and the intricate bamboo weaving of Hmunpui.

land_and_memory.title: Green Gold
land_and_memory.content: Bamboo is not just a plant here; it is the material of life, used for houses, crafts, and food.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Where history and hills converge.

description.title: Welcome to Kohima
description.content: The state capital and land of the Angami tribe. Site of the Hornbill Festival.

land_and_memory.title: Battle of Kohima
land_and_memory.content: The 'Stalingrad of the East', where the Japanese advance was halted in WWII.

sense_of_place.one_liner: The misty hills of the tattooed warriors.

description.title: Welcome to Mon
description.content: The land of the Konyak Nagas, famous for their facial tattoos and gunsmithing skills.

land_and_memory.title: The Last Headhunters
land_and_memory.content: A district where the Angh (chieftain) system still holds power, straddling the border with Myanmar.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Deep forests and vibrant tribal life.

description.title: Welcome to Dhalai
description.content: The district with the highest tribal population, known for its pristine nature.

land_and_memory.title: Green Heritage
land_and_memory.content: A land where the bamboo forests are ancient and the tribal traditions remain untouched.

sense_of_place.one_liner: Where stone gods sleep in the jungle.

description.title: Welcome to North Tripura
description.content: Famous for the massive rock-cut carvings of Unakoti and lush tea plantations.

land_and_memory.title: Unakoti
land_and_memory.content: The 'One Less Than A Crore' rock carvings tell a mythical story of Shiva's curse.

sense_of_place.one_liner: The bustling heart of the Himalayas.

description.title: Welcome to East Sikkim
description.content: Hosts the capital Gangtok and the historic Nathu La trade route to China.

land_and_memory.title: Silk Route
land_and_memory.content: Echoes of ancient traders still linger on the Old Silk Route near Nathu La.

sense_of_place.one_liner: A pristine hill district rich in tribal heritage.

description.title: Welcome to Karbi Anglong
description.content: The largest district in Assam, known for its lush green hills, rare flora, and the vibrant culture of the Karbi people.

land_and_memory.title: Ancient Hills
land_and_memory.content: These hills have been the home of the Karbi people since time immemorial, echoing with folklore and songs.

defining_themes.title: Tribal Culture
defining_themes.description: Rich traditions of the Karbi tribe.

sense_of_place.one_liner: The world's largest river island.

description.title: Welcome to Majuli
description.content: A spiritual and cultural hub in the Brahmaputra river, famous for its Satras (monasteries).

land_and_memory.title: River's Song
land_and_memory.content: Life here flows with the rhythm of the Brahmaputra.
